comment.body:
> [zer0surfer](#comment_1_15j9RixaGozV6Dwp3a9iigZNbjtUyz6Rbq): I like timeshift for system snapshots, EDIT: your CSS needs some fixing for comments, they are not readable

Thanks for the CSS heads-up, much appreciated, I've been a bit careless with my changes. I reverted back to something standard for now.

I've yet to try timeshift but I'm unsure how well it would work versus xfsdump, for system backup, I've a little less faith for hard links and rsync vs inoded-level backup.

> [qn](#comment_1_18cgercs5UABH6TrGvMWhbqpECZsfiMZm5): Kurzgesagt definitely is one of the best Youtube channels there are.

Agreed, their quality over quantity approach really shines.

> [fickenccp](#comment_1_15E2Ms8RjnhE2h77ng5GAtVbX3vRxf3PwE): I will try to translat this article into chinese.However,most tof the chinese are using windows operation system,it will be great if you worte a ss tutorial on windows op system.

Yes, I can do that, I'll take me a bit of time but otherwise no problem.

However, Linux is much more trustworthy than Windows for many reasons so switching to it if you are privacy conscious is a good move :)

> [hexkey](#comment_1_18NsJqjikBYBjwLzMVp7aBJSpqtyRSd9qF): How exactly do you pin stuff?

By editing the "Date published" of this post to always be the latest published/updated, it then sticks to the top of the blog, rinse and repeat as you add more articles :)

> [hexkey](#comment_2_18NsJqjikBYBjwLzMVp7aBJSpqtyRSd9qF): Ah. So can I set it to the year 9999?

Perhaps, I've yet to fin a limit actually, a few minutes ahead of the last post is enough of course
